subtask.name: Dismounted movement on Rose Barracks and GTA.

subtasks.hazard: Accident with military or civilian vehicle.

values: Troop will have chem light attached to rucksack.
Red lens turned on during low visibility hours.

subtask.name: Dismounted movement on Rose Barracks and GTA.

subtasks.hazard: Ruck injuries to include heat/cold injury.

values: Medical support will be on standby to treat casualties.
Soldiers will wear prescribed packing list to mitigate heat injuries.
Movement breaks as needed with deliberate hydration.
Safety Brief
OIC, NCOIC, Leaders, Troops

subtask.name: Dismounted movement on Rose Barracks and GTA.

values: Soldiers will avoid all animals and wildlife as possible.
Leaders and Troops will report any concerning encounters to the OIC/NCOIC or Command Team..
Immediate notification of any animal showing potential signs of rabies.
Safety Brief
OIC, NCOIC, Leaders, Troops

subtask.name: Dismounted movement on Rose Barracks and GTA.

values: Troops will maintain red lens during limited visibility hours.
Troops will maintain tactical staggered column formation with proper spacing to refrain from tripping over one another.
Safety Brief, SOPs
OIC, NCOIC, Leaders, Troops

subtask.name: Dismounted movement on Rose Barracks and GTA.

values: Troops will conduct proper preparation drills, stretching, and mobility exercises to prepare for ruck.
Prep Drill, Stretching, Dynamic Warm-Up
OIC, NCOIC, Leaders, Troops

subtask.name: Mounted Movement on Rose Barracks and GTA.

subtasks.hazard: Personnel injured while operating vehicle and falling off vehicles.

values: Maintain three (3) points of contact while on top of any vehicle.
Personnel will not jump off vehicles, climb off/down.
Wear ACH when climbing on/off or on top any vehicle.
No candidate will climb on top of a vehicle for any reason as part of a lane.
Safety Brief, SOPs
OIC, NCOIC, Leaders, Troops

subtask.name: Mounted Movement on Rose Barracks and GTA.

subtasks.hazard: Troops getting run over by trail vehicle.

values: Vehicle will maintain at least 50 meters from Troops in formation with hazards flashing.
When uploading casualties/fallouts, vehicle and personnel will ensure truck is stopped and brakes are engaged.
Troops being carried will be in proper uniform, seated, and vehicle tarp will be down and Troop belt latched.
Safety Brief, SOPs
OIC, NCOIC, Leaders, Troops

subtask.name: Mounted Movement on Rose Barracks and GTA.

subtasks.hazard: Hazardous road conditions as a result of inclement weather

values: All Soldiers wear seat belts/restraints. No exceptions.
Vehicles will reduce to speeds IOT allow safe operation of vehicle through terrain.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances.
Vehicle movements off-roads and/or on steep slopes will be minimized and taken with an abundance of precuation.
Recovery vehicles will be on standby.
Movements will be reported upon start and completion.
Safety Brief
OIC, NCOIC, Leaders, Troops
